description: UK lawmakers rejected a slew of changes suggested by the upper House of Lords to its plan to deport asylum seekers to Rwanda, allowing Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to progress toward fulfilling his flagship immigration pledge.
title: Sunak’s Rwanda Bill Progresses as MPs Reject Lords Amendments

description: A US Supreme Court justice refused to shield Donald Trump’s former White House adviser Peter Navarro from having to report to prison Tuesday, rejecting a request in a case with roots in the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.
title: Trump Ex-Aide Navarro Faces Prison With Supreme Court Rebuff

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken will use a visit to Manila to stress the US security commitment to the Philippines and emphasize freedom of navigation in the South China Sea at a time when China’s being more assertive in the region, a senior State Department official said.
title: Blinken to Stress Security Ties in Philippines, Official Says

description: The US Supreme Court extended a temporary hold on a Texas law that would let the state arrest and deport people who enter the country illegally, giving the justices more time to decide how to handle a politically volatile issue.
title: Supreme Court Extends Pause on Texas Migrant Deportation Law

description: One of Democratic Republic of Congo’s most prominent journalists was sentenced to six months in prison for allegedly spreading false information about the investigation into the assassination of a top opposition politician.
title: Congo Court Sentences Journalist to Six Months in Prison

description: The Biden administration’s pause on liquefied natural gas export licenses needs to end after November’s presidential election, said Ryan Lance, chief executive of ConocoPhillips, the Houston-based oil and gas producer with a growing LNG business.
title: ConocoPhillips CEO Calls for US to End LNG Permit Pause in November

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at where things stand on finishing government funding legislation. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Congress Flirts With a Government Shutdown — Again

description: Donald Trump and seven co-defendants asked a Georgia judge for permission to appeal his ruling that Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis can remain on the election-interference case despite her romance with a top prosecutor.
title: Trump Challenges Ruling Letting DA Willis Stay on Georgia Case

description: The Biden administration warned Cuba’s government that human rights must be respected as social unrest builds on the impoverished, communist-run Caribbean island.
title: US and Cuba Trade Barbs After Power Cuts Spark Street Protests

description: Portugal’s far-right Chega party said there’s still no agreement to back a government led by center-right coalition AD following the snap election held on March 10.
title: Portugal’s Chega Still Has No Agreement With Center-Right Group

description: Joachim Nagel, president of Deutsche Bundesbank, during A Bloomberg Television interview following the central bank's "Annual Report 2023" news conference in Frankfurt, Germany, on Friday, Feb. 23, 2024. "When we’re talking about financial markets, it’s often better to do things like that in a gradual manner," Nagel said. Photographer: Alex Kraus/Bloomberg
title: Nagel Says Lack of Banking Union Resembles a Systemic Failure

description: Mexico President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said the nation will continue to support state oil producer Petroleos Mexicanos as the company works to ramp up production at its local refineries and reduce its massive debt load.
title: AMLO Celebrates Oil Takeover Anniversary With Vow to Back Pemex

description: The European Union has prepared legislation that would see Ukraine start to receive profits generated by frozen Russian sovereign assets as early as July.
title: EU Drafts Law to Send Russian Central Bank Profits to Ukraine

description: Foreign ministers of the European Union agreed on new sanctions related to the death of the Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny in an Arctic prison last month.
title: EU Backs New Sanctions Against Russia Over Navalny’s Death

description: With each new week, Rishi Sunak’s grip on the UK political narrative appears to be diminishing.
title: Sunak Struggles for Control in Face of Dire Polls and Tory Anger

description: President Joe Biden is ramping up efforts to win back the western battleground states of Arizona and Nevada, with visits designed to shore up support from voters who backed him in 2020 and have since drifted.
title: Biden Aims to Defend Nevada, Arizona in Western Campaign Swing

description: Gunvor Group Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Torbjörn Törnqvist estimates about 600,000 barrels of Russia’s daily oil-refining capacity has been knocked out by Ukrainian drone strikes.
title: Gunvor Says Drones Shut Down 600,000 Barrels of Russia Refining

description: The US and Japan proposed a United Nations Security Council resolution that would warn countries against placing nuclear weapons in orbit, as it ramps up pressure on Russia to abandon potential plans to put warheads in space.
title: US and Japan Team Up to Warn Against Nuclear Weapons in Space

description: Senior officials from the Justice Department and other agencies will try to convince skeptical senators during a closed-door briefing Tuesday that TikTok can continue to operate in the US while being severed from its Chinese owner, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Biden Officials to Brief Wary Senators on TikTok Sale Push

description: President Gustavo Petro is trying to build popular support for his bid to overhaul Colombia’s constitution, which faces long odds of success given legislative and judicial hurdles.
title: Petro Lays Out Long-Shot Plan for Colombia Constitutional Rework

description: The two-year Treasury note’s yield climbed to its highest level since December as expectations for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year continued to erode, with traders dropping the odds of a June rate cut to less than 50% and economists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. revising their forecast.
title: Fed Swaps Price In Less Than 50% Chance of a June Rate Cut

description: The UK failed to spend £478 million ($608 million) of last year’s budget for making homes and buildings greener, in the latest setback to government initiatives to decarbonize the economy.
title: UK Undershoots Budget for Making Homes Greener by £478 Million

description: The US Supreme Court signaled reluctance to curb the Biden administration’s contacts with social media companies, hearing a case that will shape efforts to tackle election interference and misinformation during the final months of the 2024 campaign.
title: Supreme Court Wary of Ban on White House’s Social Media Contacts

description: Algeria vowed to retaliate against Morocco’s plan to annex the site of its former embassy, upping tensions between the long-feuding neighbors on Europe’s doorstep.
title: Old Embassy Is Latest Flashpoint in Simmering North African Feud

description: Advisers to Donald Trump are floating a shortlist of names to chair the Federal Reserve should the former president win a second term, with candidates including prominent tax-cut advocate Arthur Laffer, former Fed governor Kevin Warsh and Kevin Hassett, a one-time chair of the White House Council of Economic Advisers.
title: Trump Advisers Float Shortlist of Names for Fed Chair

description: House Republicans have launched a second probe of the Biden administration’s move to pause liquefied natural gas export approvals, questioning if election-year politics played a role in the decision.
title: Biden’s Gas Export Pause Faces Second Probe by House Republicans

description: The possibility of a famine looms over northern Gaza as half the population of the area already faces “crisis levels of food insecurity or worse,” the United Nations warned.
title: Famine Is Imminent in Northern Gaza, UN-Backed Report Warns

description: Inside Brazil’s presidential palace, angst is mounting as the economy sputters along, churning out tepid growth figures month after month. President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is ratcheting up the pressure on his top aides to boost spending, gin up faster growth and turn around his sinking approval ratings.
title: Lula Irks Investors in Bid to Spur Brazil Growth, Boost Approval

description: President Joe Biden plans to speak Monday with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, according to people familiar with the matter, as the two leaders clash over the war in Gaza.
title: Biden, Netanyahu to Speak Amid Mounting Tensions Over Gaza War

description: Moldovan President Maia Sandu announced that a referendum on European Union membership will be held in October as she seeks to ensure the nation of 2.6 million maintains progress toward joining the bloc.
title: Moldovan President Seeks Referendum on EU Membership in October

description: A day after Vladimir Putin claimed a record victory in presidential elections tightly controlled by the Kremlin, Russia is marking the 10th anniversary of his annexation of Crimea that began the march to war in Ukraine.
title: Putin Basks in Election Win on Anniversary of Crimea Annexation

description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan, who launched his re-election campaign for a third term on Monday, pledged to build 40,000 new council homes by the end of the decade as part of efforts to address a housing shortage in the city.
title: London Mayor Vows 40,000 New Council Homes in Election Campaign

description: Croatia’s highest court said President Zoran Milanovic’s abrupt decision to run in next month’s election to become prime minister is “irreconcilable” with his role as head of state.
title: Croatia’s Top Court Rules Milanovic Can’t Run for Premiership

description: Transit operators in San Francisco’s Bay Area are facing massive budget shortfalls as ridership lingers well below its prepandemic levels. Two California senators will unveil a bill Monday aimed at plugging those gaps, as well as bringing some order to the 27 different agencies operating across the region.
title: California Senators Float Plan to Plug Bay Area Transit Budget Gaps

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: A Miserable Business: Economic Woes Pile Pressure On The PM

description: Pakistan’s central bank held the key interest rate at a record high for a sixth straight meeting, as a newly-elected government holds loan talks with the International Monetary Fund that wants a tight monetary policy to curb inflation.
title: Pakistan Keeps Key Rate at Record With IMF Talks Underway

description: The worst may not be over for Ghana’s cedi, Africa’s third-worst performing currency this year.
title: More Tough Times Ahead for Ghana’s Cedi as Debt Workout Drags

description: Bulgaria’s president gave former Prime Minister Boyko Borissov’s party a week to form a new government as the Balkan country risks extending a political crisis that’s hurt its efforts to join the euro area and gain access to European Union funds.
title: Bulgaria Seeks to Avoid More Turmoil With New Government Mandate

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: AI’s Rise Is Unstoppable Whatever Government Leaders Do

description: China has appointed a Foreign Ministry spokesman who previously worked for an entity sanctioned by the US government, a choice that comes as the world’s largest economies work to mend frayed ties.
title: China Appoints Foreign Ministry Spokesman Who Worked in Xinjiang

description: The Biden administration is rolling out an executive order to strengthen women’s health research standards across federal agencies and prioritize its funding in an effort to close the gap on long-standing disparities.
title: White House Unveils Executive Order to Boost Women’s Health

description: Eight people were killed in air strikes by Pakistani military targeting the border regions in east Afghanistan, a development that could stir tensions between the neighboring countries.
title: Eight Killed After Pakistan Air Strikes Hit East Afghanistan

description: Cooperation between the government and business is boosting South Africa’s prospects, despite the myriad challenges the economy faces, US Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo said.
title: US Treasury’s Adeyemo Says He’s More Bullish on South Africa

description: China is considering taking part in a Ukraine peace conference planned by Switzerland, according to Wang Shihting, its ambassador to the European country.
title: China Is Considering Swiss Peace Talks on Ukraine, Report Says

description: China seems to be toning down its military pressure on Taiwan, according to security officials from the self-governed island, who warned Beijing will still likely continue its diplomatic isolation campaign.
title: China Military Exercising Restraint Lately, Taiwan Officials Say

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken warned that authoritarian governments were going to meddle in a flurry of elections and the US would keep pressing to disrupt misinformation efforts from China and Russia.
title: Blinken Warns of False Info ‘Flood’ As Elections Loom Worldwide

description: Hong Kong’s legislature will convene Tuesday to resume reading of a new security bill that’s being fast-tracked by the government.
title: Hong Kong Security Legislation Nears Vote as Lawmakers to Meet

description: Vietnam’s parliament is set to hold a special session on Thursday to discuss “personnel matters” that may include the possible resignation of President Vo Van Thuong, according to officials with knowledge of the matter.
title: Vietnam Parliament to Meet Amid Speculation President May Resign

description: Fixing years of underinvestment also means preparing for the future.
title: Putin and Trump Force Defense Rethink in Europe

description: Israel’s military made its deepest incursion into Gaza City in about two weeks, saying its troops were undertaking a “precise operation” targeting the main hospital in the northern metropolis that bore the brunt of the first weeks of fighting in the conflict.
title: Israel’s Forces Target Hamas Activities at Gaza City Hospital

description: Protesters took to the streets of Cuba on Sunday in a rare outburst of social unrest as a fresh wave of blackouts exacerbated tensions on the cash-strapped island.
title: Protesters Take to Streets in Cuba as Lights Go Out Across Island

description: Slogans matter in China. From “socialism with Chinese characteristics” to “common prosperity” the adoption of new catchphrases can herald profound shifts in policy.
title: Decoding Xi’s New Catchphrase Aimed at Reviving China’s Economy
